name: Residence Inn Anaheim Maingate

reviews.title: Had a great time!
reviews.text: We spent five days with our two grandchildren (4 1/2 and 22 months). Our studio room was tight for our stay but we managed. Love the location - we walked to Disneyland everyday. We had tickets for ART but never used them. There is construction between hotel and parks so walking on the sidewalks have now gotten to be more of a problem. Construction has closed one of the sidewalks so only one left to walk on. The pool was wonderful and warm. The kids loved it! Our biggest problem was breakfast. What a frenzy. Food was good and always was being refilled but such a crowd!!! People everywhere and sometimes no place to sit down to eat. Breakfast staff tried to keep places cleared but was almost impossible. Breakfast area is large but almost could have used two areas to serve breakfast. This was our only negative of our trip. Maybe solution would be to offer discount if you don't eat at the breakfast. Next time we would probably get food at store and eat in our room. Much less stressful. Front desk staff were friendly and attentive. Would stay again.

reviews.title: Good Location, Great Breakfast
reviews.text: I recently stayed at this hotel for a 5 day Disneyland vacation with my 10 year old daughter and 20 year old nephew. We booked a studio suite and were very pleased with the size and cleanliness of the room and the in-room kitchen facilities.The complimentry breakfast buffet at this hotel is excellent and there is something for everyone. I personally recommend the oatmeal! The hotel is within walking distance of Disneyland but we were happy to take the shuttle or a cab (cost $9.00 including tip) back to the hotel at the end of the day (some evenings we were just too tired from running around Disneyland all day to walk back). There are hotels/motels that are closer to Disneyland, if walking distance is your main concern, but I would book here again in the future despite the slightly longer walk of about 10 minutes. I found the hotel staff, housekeeping, front desk and the breakfast buffet wait staff to be friendly and helpful.

reviews.title: Would recommend this hotel
reviews.text: The good: Full kitchen with oven, microwave, full fridge, dishes and utensils. The grocery service is the greatest. We used it twice. We filled out a grocery list, dropped it off at the front desk in the morning, and when we got back from Disneyland in the afternoon, all the food was in the frige and ready to make dinner. They bought us exactly what we ordered, and no delivery fee. The breakfast was also really great. Nice to have some food before heading off to D-land.

reviews.title: Residence Inn Maingate was WONDERFUL!
reviews.text: Just so-so: Our room had just one queen bed and a pull out sofa. Once the sofa is pulled out there's not a lot of room to move around, but we weren't in the room all that much. The stairs up to the room are kind of a pain if you have a lot of luggage.

reviews.title: Very clean and good sized rooms, plus breakfast
reviews.text: The bad: When we arrived we were told the pool and hot tubs were closed down by the health department. I had been tracking the renovation of the pool on-line before our trip, making sure it was complete before we arrived. They said it could be closed up to a month! This was very diappointing to our girls. They offered free swimming at a near-by hotel's pool (not convenient), but luckily the next day the pool was open. And by the 2nd or 3rd day one of the hot tubs was open too.

reviews.title: Great family property, minor problems but they took care of us.
reviews.text: Awesome location for Disneyland, great shuttle, great breakfast (for a buffet), great value, pool was 87 degrees and perfectly cleen, baby pool was clean, jacuzzi was perfect! The rooms were big (unlike other residence inns I've stayed at). We had a backdraft in the fireplace on one night and had to move rooms at 1:30 in the morning. They comp'd us into an upgraded two room suite though and never flinched. Oh, beware of the laundry service, fading and shrinking are guaranteed. Awesome experience though and we stayed for nearly a week.

reviews.title: This was a good deal and a great location
reviews.text: Must say this hotel is really pretty good. Staff was friendly, rooms were clean and comfortable, location was great. We got a fair price via Expedia. It's very convenient to take the ART transportation to Disneyland. Breakfast was busy, but was pretty good food and the staff seemed to keep up with the constant flow. We visited for 5 days and will probably return and will definitely recommend this to friends. They are very family friendly.

reviews.title: Had a Great Time
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights at the Residence Inn Maingate during our trip to Disneyland and were completely satisfied with the property. We had a one bedroom suite with a fold-out bed in the living room which was very spacious. We also had a small balcony with a table and chairs which was nice for sitting out and enjoying the weather. We found the staff helpful and pleasant. The grounds are beautifully maintained and the breakfast was more than adequate (pancakes or french toast, waffles, fruit salad, cereal, eggs, various breakfast meats, bagels, muffins, tortillas etc). They also have coffee available all day. The breakfast room can get crowded, especially on the weekends but when the weather is nice, there is a pleasant outside patio. We used the ART to get to and from the park as the walk seemed a bit far with a 5 year old and you have to walk by an empty construction zone. You can get an all-day pass for the ART at the hotel for $3. The bus stops at 3 other hotels but it's very quick (maybe 8 minutes to the park). If you know the approximate times that the buses arrive then there is little waiting. They also have a small "store" where you can buy some basics such as milk. The hotel has a nice pool area and another hot-tub tucked away near units 20-24. The only downside is that all one-bedroom suites are upstairs so you have to lug your things up and down and this could be a problem for people who cannot handle stairs. Check with the hotel in advance if stairs are a problem. The only other issue was that the Disneyland Express operated by Grey Line Tours cannot get into the property because of the size of the bus. We had to haul our suitcases to the street. I would recommend going with a compnay that has smaller vans that can go right up to the front desk/lobby area.

reviews.title: Stay away!
reviews.text: We came here as the first hotel on our Honeymoon trip. What a terrible stay. We were moved twice, due to noise and cleaniness, staff didnt know anything, there are much better hotels to stay at for this price.

reviews.title: Pretty good overall
reviews.text: Rooms are dark, light switches are randomly placed where you cant find the actual one you are looking for!, Walkable to Disneyland (Approx. 15 mins). Breakfast awful, wouldn't recommend to anyone. Stay away!

reviews.title: Very clean and convenient
reviews.text: Just got back from a week at Disneyland. We LOVED the hotel. It was very clean and had everything we needed. We asked the maid service for a few items and they brought them to us right away. Very close to the park (we walked the first day..20 minutes?). We drove the other days just so we could be there 1st thing in the morning. The pool and hot tub were fantastic. The breakfast wasn't that great, but it offered enough to fill our stomaches for the morning. Next time we go, we'll probably stay there again.

reviews.title: Perfect Hotel for Visiting Disneyland
reviews.text: My wife, two children, and I stayed at the Residence Inn Maingate for 5 nights. We loved everything about it. We booked a 1bedroom unit, which features a separate bedroom with 2 comfortable queen beds and a family room with sleeper sofa and kitchen. The kitchen consists of a oven, stovetop, microwave, dishwasher, and sink. Each day we enjoyed the free hot breakfast. There were 2 alternating menus. The first consisted of french toast and bacon; the second was pancakes and sausage. There were also eggs, burritos, make-your-own waffle, cereal, potatoes, fruit, and other options. We filled up on a huge breakfast, ate snacks in the theme parks, and fixed dinner in the room at night. We saved a fortune on food. The pool was warmly heated. Our group of 5 or 6 buildings had its own hot tub, which was quite relaxing. We used the ART shuttle to get to Disney--you could walk, but I would recommend the shuttle to save all of your energy for the parks. Besides, ART is free for kids under 10. We highly recommend Residence Inn.

reviews.title: The place for space!
reviews.text: We added an extra night to the beginning or our Disneyland Trip and decided to stay that night in the Residence Inn Main Gate (the remaining 4 days we stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel).

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel for families
reviews.text: The room at the Residence Inn was great. It was huge. We stayed in a "Penthouse Suite" which had two bedrooms (a bunk-bed and a King bed). I would definitely recommend this hotel for families that need extra room. We were also impressed with the full kitchen and the free breakfast buffet. There was also free wireless internet access and free parking (the parking was close to the room too). We were also within easy walking distance of the parks (not quite as close as the Disney hotels, but still close enough that we didn't have to take a shuttle...even though they were available).

reviews.title: Perfect Location! Great For Families!
reviews.text: The room was showing some signs of age (mainly the cabinets and drawers were worn out), but the beds were comfortable, and the room was clean. The service was not as nice as the Grand Californian where we stayed the rest of our trip, but I would definitely consider staying at the Residence Inn again (especially if I felt I needed more space than most other hotels provide). I'd also stay here again if I wanted to try to save some money.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!
reviews.text: We were recently at the Residence Inn as part of a large family trip to Disneyland. This is an excellent property that's within reasonable walking distance from Disneyland.

reviews.title: Clean, very good staff
reviews.text: This particular property seems to be a converted condominium complex. Each room/suite was very spacious and clean. They had very well equipped kitchens. The two suites that we stayed in also had fireplaces! Do keep in mind that this is a two-storey property. If you are staying on the 2nd floor, you will have to lug your luggage up a flight of stairs. There are no elevators.

reviews.title: Fantastic Stay at the Residence inn
reviews.text: As with most other properties close to Disneyland, this place offers a complimentary breakfast. They give you breakfast vouchers based on the number of people in your room and the length of the room. You are supposed to turn in those vouchers when you show up for breakfast. But the requirements seemed rather lax. One morning, we forgot our vouchers in the room, but were not asked to go back and get them! Very nice on their part.

reviews.title: Loved it ... and I'm kind of a snob ;)
reviews.text: When you check-in, do make sure where your room location is w.r.t. I-5 which runs right next to the property! If you are very close to it (like we were), you will not be able to keep your door open. It's too loud. But once you close the door, you can't hear a thing.

reviews.title: Awesome Hotel-would definitely recommend
reviews.text: Overall, I think this is an excellent property which is very clean and convenient - if you are there to visit Disneyland.

aka: Residence Inn Anaheim Maingate Hotel Anaheim
description: A very unique all suite condo style hotel located 1/2 mile from Disneyland. All suites have fully equipped kitchens & full size pull out sofa sleepers. We offer suites that can accommodate up to 8 people. We offer the following free amenities: breakfast, grocery shopping services, social hour, parking, internet, business center usage. Our guests have access to purchasing exclusive discounted park tickets through our on property Disney Desk. On property fire pit & BBQ Grills. Pet Friendly.
